title: Nova Scotia Skilled Worker Immigration Program - Fulfilling Your Dreams! (Aashirya Sharma)
text: By Aashirya Sharma Aug 14, 2015 Presently, immigration overseas has become a new fad. Among many countries, Canada is one such nation that witnesses thousands of people moving here for leisure, study or business needs every year. To make the Canadian immigration process simpler and to give the international masses a privilege to permanently settle in Canada, Nova Scotia Skilled Worker Immigration Program has been introduced. It assists employers to recruit foreign workers and recently passed graduates from other countries and give them an opportunity to become permanent residents of the Canadian province.As part of this program, the Nova Scotia office of Immigration holds the right to grant only specific types of jobs and occupations for the nomination, depending on the current economic condition of the Nova Scotia labor market needs. If you are willing to immigrate to Nova Scotia through this program, you must have a full-time, permanent job offer from a Nova Scotia company. However, the preferences will be given to those whose employers have made an honest effort to recruit qualified citizens or permanent residents or the employers who can attest that they will assist novices with their settlement needs.What's below is the eligibility requirement of the Nova Scotia skilled worker immigration program that you need to know before applying for it. #1 Legal status in the country of residence: To apply for this program, you must have a legal status in your country of residence. Let's say, if you are a resident of Canada, you must give the proof of your legal status as a temporary worker or visitor whereas if you are applying from outside Canada, you must provide the proof that you have legal status in your country of residence. #2 Age: You must be between 21 to 55 years of age while applying for Nova Scotia skilled worker immigration. #3 Education and training: A degree equivalent to Canadian high school diploma with a minimum 12 years of education and training from the recognized institute or authority is a must to apply for this program. Apart from this, you should also have an appropriate academic qualification, training as well as certification required for the position. #4 Language proficiency: If your primary language is not English or French, you must submit the written proof that must certify that you meet the Canadian Language Benchmarks (CLB) for at least CLB/NCLC Level 5. Even if your spoken language is English or French, you must submit globally verified test results to prove a minimum CLB/NCL Level 4. #5 Work experience: While submitting an application, you must have work experience equivalent to 12 months within the last 5 years, associated to the position and skills for the job. The grounds of work experience will be verified by certified education and work experience through your resume and supporting employment documents. #6 Financial and settlement support: To successfully pave your ways to Nova Scotia, you will have to exhibit that you have sufficient financial resources, including transferable funds in your name or your spouse's name, in order to pay your immigration costs and travel expenses (if applicable) and to successfully stabilize yourself and your family in Nova Scotia. About the Author Aashirya Sharma is a professional writer and her work are being published in several magazines and online portals to national acclaim.
